summary: This document is an email chain from August 2020 regarding the processing and uploading of digital evidence from seized devices in the Ghislaine Maxwell case to the Relativity e-discovery platform. It discusses the transfer of a flash drive containing folders for five devices, confirms receipt, and addresses outstanding questions about supplemental materials, duplicate folders, missing items, and zero-byte files.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The email chain's subject references materials for 'Maxwell upload to Relativity', indicating the digital evidence being processed is related to her case.

persons.name: Francesco
persons.context: Mentioned as someone who might assist with outstanding evidence questions if the primary contact is unavailable.

events.title: Hard drive shipment confirmation
events.description: Confirmation that a hard drive containing evidence materials was sent and expected to arrive the next day.

events.title: Planned thumb drive mailing
events.description: A plan is discussed to mail a thumb drive containing folders for five devices (NYC024332, NYC024369, NYC024369_1, NYC024372, NYC024384) on the coming Monday for processing and upload to Relativity.

events.title: Evidence status update and spreadsheet provided
events.description: An updated, color-coded spreadsheet of evidence status was provided, noting five items still to be delivered and drives requiring hardware recovery.

keyFacts: The document is part of the evidence management process for the Ghislaine Maxwell case, focusing on uploading digital materials to the Relativity platform.
Specific device folders are referenced (e.g., NYC024332, NYC024369, NYC024372, NYC024384), indicating these are seized items being processed for evidence.
There is discussion of 'zero byte files' (approximately 71,000) found in initial device extractions, which may be empty files or artifacts of the recovery process.
Some devices (e.g., NYC024376-380, drives in NYC024395) are noted as still being processed, with some drives physically failed and requiring specialist hardware recovery.
The email chain shows coordination between parties to ensure all evidence is accounted for, with questions about duplicate folders, missing items (NYC027913), and supplemental materials.
